intro: Epigynum graciliflorum, commonly known as the slender-flowered epigynum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its delicate, elongated flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. Its leaves are ovate and hairy, often arranged alternately along the stem. Epigynum graciliflorum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
